abtl5: Programmer / Product Manager /  Web3 Personal Researcher
abtl4: By Web3text Mint function, Your texts convert to jpeg , save to IPFS and then becomes an entries on-chain that bleongs to you only.
abtl3: Writing NFTs are a new type of digital asset that represents your entries on-chain.
abtl2: Web3text use tiptap. tiptap is a headless wrapper around ProseMirror – a toolkit for building rich text WYSIWYG editors, which is already in use at many well-known companies such as New York Times, The Guardian or Atlassian.
abtl1: Web3 is a new world rebuilt from scratch, it has a new order and rules (Code is Law), a new way of organization (DAO), a new identity (NFT&ENS), and a new indigenous people (0x address) . So We developed Web3text!
qal1: Disclaimer: Do your own research, it means you must do your own research to make the purchase decision.
qal2: Fungible token is a currency-like token that can be exchanged at any time.
qal3: Non-fungible token is a unique and non-interchangeable unit of data stored on a blockchain.
qal4: Any transaction happens on the blockchain requires “Gas Fee” which is used to reward miners for maintaining the decentralized network.
qal5: The NFT project is a free mint project, however, minting an NFT still needs miners from blockchain to finish jobs such as executing, validating and etc. As a result, gas fee is unavoidable.
qal6: What needs to be mentioned is that the gas fee fluctuates all the time. You would notice that the “gas fee” section in MetaMask keeps refreshing. Why is that?
qal7: This is because there's a capacity limit on each block and not all the transactions will be packed in time. Miners would always pack transactions with higher gas fee first. Hence, the more gas fee you pay, the faster your transaction will be completed.
qal8: We would recommend you to mint when the gas fee is low. In this case, it will save you some ETH. You can check live gas fee on https://etherscan.io/gastracker 15 to 40 Gwei is a good gas fee range for minting.
